Author: wrdg
Content: Enforce Script has a similar syntax to C# and a bit of C, picking up an actual language can help you in terms of understanding OOP and syntax, but there isn't a language that i would recommend getting into if you're wanting to do scripting in DayZ. it was a bit easier for me coming from C#, as EnfScript shares similarities in terms of syntax. there's not much of a better resource than the unpacked game itself, it's like picking up an undocumented library, so you just browse through the source to understand what you're wanting to accomplish or utilize
